text.content:
JOB#: 906918

PATIENT NAME: AVIVAPATIENT, SIX

DATE OF ADMISSION: 11/18/2011

DATE OF DISCHARGE: 11/20/2011

DIAGNOSES: Pneumonia

PROCEDURE/OP PERFORMED:  None.

HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: This patient presented to the ER with complaints of 
fever, shortness of breath and cough for 3 days.  Upon examination, she had mild 
rhonci in bilateral lower lobes, and elveated WBC.  Chest xray reveled 
infiltrates in bilateral lower lobes.  Patient was admitted for IV antibiotics.

PAST MEDICAL HISTORY: 
Hypertension, Depression, type 2 Diabetes, Hyperlipidemia, Osteopenia.  History 
of malignant neoplasm of thyroid, and Postoperative hypothyroidism
 
PAST SURGICAL HISTORY:
Thyroidectomy (complete, bilateral) in 2002
 
PHYSICAL EXAMINATION:  VITAL SIGNS ON ADMISSION:  107/51(68) HR 108, 91% O2 sat 
by pulse ox on 4L NC rr 22.  GENERAL:  on admission fever, chills x 48 hours, 
denies recent weight gain ENT: no vision changes NECK: no stiff neck 
CARDIAC:  denies chest pain  RESPIRATORY: + SOB/DOE LUNGS: Diminished breath 
sounds due to obesity, Rhonci noted B lower lobes ABDOMEN:  non-tender 
EXTREMITIES: + swelling

LABORATORY, RADIOLOGICAL AND OTHER PERTINENT TEST RESULTS PERTINENT TO 
ADMISSION: CBC with elevated WBC, mild Left shift.  Chest Xray with infiltrates. 
Both have improved during 48 hours of antibiotics. 

HOSPITAL COURSE: uneventful

DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS:  Patient was discharged on 11/20/2011

DISPOSITION/FOLLOW-UP CARE:  Patient was discharged to home in good 
condition. Patient was also scheduled for followup with PCP in 6-8 weeks to 
evaluate Hypertension, diabetes, and medication regimine.  Patient encouraged to 
finish 14 day course of Antibitoics, follow up with PCP clinic if cough returns, 
return to ER or call 911 for Shortness of Breath, Chest pain.


DATE DICTATED: 11/20/11@13:55
GGS/DATE TRANSCRIBED: 18677879/11/20/2011 17:48:25
VA JobID/906918
GGSJobID/Rev: 906918/0


$END
text.author: RESIDENT,ONE
